archdesc.runner: Special Collections, Virginia Polytechnic Institute and State University

did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.repository: Special Collections, Virginia Polytechnic Institute and State University, Blacksburg, Va.
did.abstract: The Papers of Lilia Gramatikova consist of nine black and white photos of the Folk Music School that she did in the Village of Shiroka Luka, as well as a color photocopy of the school after its completion in 1979.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Researchers wishing to cite this collection should include the following information: Lilia Gramatikova Architectural Papers, Ms2001-023 - Special Collections, Virginia Polytechnic Institute and State University, Blacksburg, Va.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: The Lilia Gramatikova Architectural Papers were donated to Special Collections in 2000.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: The processing, arrangement, and description of the Lilia Gramatikova Architectural Papers commenced and was completed in 2001.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The Papers of Lilia Gramatikova consist of nine black and white photos of the Folk Music School that Gramatikova did in the Village of Shiroka Luka, as well as a color photocopy of the school after its completion in 1979. The collection also includes a photocopy of a drawing of Gramatikova's personal residence in Sofia, completed in 1965.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is arranged reverse chronologically.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: See also the IAWA Small Collections. Finding aid available on the Virginia Heritage database.

did.unittitle: 9 black and white photos and 1 color photocopy of the Folk Music School, 1971-79.
1 photocopy of a drawing of Gramatikova's residence in Sofia, 1960-65.
